Leaves: Blades 8-35 cm long, thread-like, often rolled inwardly or outwardly. Rough and hairless surface, with hairy edges and base.
Flowers: Elongated clusters 10-25 cm long with widely-spaced cylindrical florets. Brownish-purple in appearance.
FruitSeeds: Yellowish-brown, narrow, 2-3 mm long seeds, completely hairy.
Habitat: Roadsides, grasslands, stream banks, pastures, waste areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: Very hard to distinguish from Broad kernal espartillo (*Amelichloa caudata*) but usually has more hairy and narrow seeds.
